shortcontents.shortcontent: Fragments of three various manuscripts I) Unidentified text [Old or New Testament?] (fols. 1r-5v) II) Gospel of Matthew, incomplete (Mt. 5) (fol. 6rv) III) Mäṣḥafä gәbrä ḥǝmamat “Book of the Rite of the Holy Week”, incomplete (readings for Wednesday e.g., fols.8r-9v, 38rv; Thursday e.g., fols. 32rv, 42rv-51v; Friday e.g., fols. 16r-23v; 24r-25v; 26r-31v).

txstates.txstate: Fragments of three Mss. put together, without binding. Several fols. are stained with water and humidity (e.g., fols. 32, 35, 39), which affected in particular the center fold of the quires of fols. 44-53. Most of the margins and the center fold of the quires are damaged, probably by rodents (e.g., fols. 12, 13, 30, 33, 41). Several fols. are damaged, parts of the text are lost (e.g., fols. 1-7). Many fols. are missing, some are misplaced (e.g., fols. 24, 35), many are loose (e.g., fols. 12, 31, 33, 43) and some are severed from their counterpart (e.g., fols. 1-7). Strips of parchment have been cut from the right margins of fols. 16, 21, 26, 27, 31, 37 and from the bottom margins of fols. 19, 39, 40. Cuts carefully repaired on fols. 4, 36.

bindings.binding: The original binding is missing. Possibly, two pairs of sewing station.

txquires.txquire: The number of the quires cannot be established due to the poor condition of the binding.

squires.squire: The structure of the quires cannot be established due to the poor condition of the binding. Fols. 1-5, of a smaller size, are probably from a different Ms (unidentified text). Fol. 6, of a smaller size, is originated from a different Four Gospels book; a few more fols. of this Ms. have been preserved in DZ-001 (Cp. D. NOSNITSIN, “The Antiquities of Däbrä Zäyt Qǝddǝst Maryam”, Aethiopica 14, 2011, 33-46).

taunit.ln-info: Changes in some cases, s. fols. 14r, 16r (32ls.), 15r (34ls.).
taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are partly visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are partly visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

ptypeofscripts.ptypeofscript: Hand a: late 15th - 16th cent. Hand b: 14th cent. Hand c: first half of the 16th century.

pchangeofhands.pchangeofhand:
Hand b: the samt hand as that of fols. 241-245 on Ms. DZ-001. Hand c: the left vertical stroke of the letter ሰ is often slightly waving (particularly visible in the sixth order: e.g., fols. 16va l.1, 20ra l.1, 27ra l.3, 31ra l.1). See AP-009 and THMR-002.
Crux ansata is used as a text divider on fol. 6vb. Coronis is used as a text divider on fols. 6vb, 52vb.

rubrications.rubrication: Headings and incipits of the texts, their sections and subsections (a few lines are rubricated alternating with black lines, fols. 23ra, 32r, 36vb); titles of the Biblical books and other works; elements of the punctuation signs; Ethiopic numbers (sometimes only elements); names of Hebrew letters on fols. 16va-17rb (Lam. 3); directives for the ministers; elements of text dividers.

otherdetails.otherdetail: For hand c that wrote the text of fol. 6rv, see D. NOSNITSIN, “The Antiquities of Däbrä Zäyt Qǝddǝst Maryam”, Aethiopica 14, 2011, 33-46.

extras.extra: - Amendments written over erasures, fols. 24r l.2, 41r l.23, 48r l.32. - Excerpts of hymns for the Good Friday (?) added in the upper margins on fols. 16rv, 18r, 29v, 30rv. - Writing exercises, fols. 17rb (upper margin), 41vb, 53vb (bottom margin).

frames.frame: - Fol. 32r: elaborate coloured (black and red) ornamental band extending up to the upper edge of the page, with two lateral and one central extensions reaching the middle of the text; interlaced, geometric motifs. - Fols. 19rb, 23ra, 35va: simple coloured (black and red) ornamental bands; interlaced, geometric motifs.
